Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Order for exception filters" (#1470) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,

According to the docs filters that implement IOrderedFilter are executed in ascending order, but it seems that the exception filter with the highest order number is executed first.
Is this because the exception filter is an “after-stage” filter and therefore the order is descending?
Is there a bug in the docs? 
Is it ensured that “after-stage” filters will be executed in descending order?
Thanks,
Mike

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Bring back InMemory compilation." (#1471) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We know that InMemory compilation was removed from RC2.

What is the status of this?
Will it come back? If not, why not?

This was a critical feature for me and the experience was amazing. 
Added a lot of value to the product.
I really, really **really** miss that.

Please?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "WebHostBuilder.UseStartup<>() Must have a constraint for class type" (#1472) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Something list this:

```
public static IWebHostBuilder UseStartup<TStartup>(this IWebHostBuilder hostBuilder) where TStartup : class, IAppStartup
```

Or even a base class with required constructor, so I know from the beginning what method must be implemented.

There is NO way for me at the moment to understand the Startup class methods and their signature w/o reading some examples and docs or launching the app.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "'Could not be found error' when creating project called 'ASP.NET Core Web Application (.NET Framework)'" (#1476) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm using RC2 with VIsual Studio 2015 update 2.

If a create a new project which targets the full .Net Framework and call the project 'ASP.NET Core Web Application (.NET Framework)' I get five errors, see below for an example:

c:\users\xxxx\documents\gihub\ASP.NET Core Web Application (.NET Framework)\src\ASP.NET Core Web Application (.NET Framework)\error CS2001: Source file 'c:\users\xxxx\documents\gihub\ASP.NET Core Web Application (.NET Framework)\src\ASP.NET Core Web Application (.NET Framework)\Core' could not be found.

If I then create a new project in the same solution, again targeting the full .Net Framework, but call the project something without spaces/brackets/periods like 'ASPNETCoreNetFramework' it works fine.

Leads to me think the projects with 'funky characters' in the project name are causing this issue.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Finalize method is unavailable" (#1477) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: I have noticed that the finalize method has been disabled in RC2. Is there a work around for that?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "RequireHttps Attribute" (#1478) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hey All,

Does anyone know if the RequireHttps attribute behavior changed? I have a web site I converted from RC1 where the RequireHttps attribute worked as expected. But now when I hit a controller adorned with RequireHttps it does not redirect me to the page under SSL instead I get a page cannot be found error. Any ideas?

Thanks!

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How to restore cshtml from nuget packages." (#1490) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
If I use packInclude on my project, I get to include `.cshtml` file on my nuget package. That's great!

Is there any way so that I include this package into another project and restores those `.cshtml`?

Like:

ProjectA produces -> ProjectAWithCshtmlFiles
ProbjecB have ProjectA dependency and restores `.cshtml` files on dotnet restore.

If that's not possible, creating a dotnet tool for that exact purpose is doable ?

The scenario I'm trying to do is to bake an interface for my package so consumers can see and opt in to create new ones (not override the existing one) or use the provided as default.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Class libraries no longer automatically create NuGet package?" (#1491) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: With prior version of ASP.NET 5, class libraries automatically created NuGet packages on build. This no longer appears to be the case with RC2. Was that an intentional change? I don't see any posts about it in the announcements repo.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ApplicationParts with settings" (#1496) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: I have started looking at ApplicationParts to build a modular MVC application. As each of my application parts has a settings files I was wondering if there is any guidance on how to dynamically load the settings for all application parts in Startup.cs (similar to the pattern to load all assemblies for from Plugins folder documented [here](https://github.com/aspnet/Mvc/issues/4089). Thanks!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Extend Chatsample with groups" (#1256) at aspnet/SignalR
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi
I have a project where I need to use the presence functionality from the chatsample on multiple pages. Therefore I would like to extend the presence functionality from the chatsample, but I am uncertain as to how the hub should be implemented.
The idea is that the hub can be access from different pages (representing a game between 2 contestant). 

Therefore the user should be added to a group that is specific for the game he is visiting and whenever the `OnUsersJoined` and `OnUsersLeft` is called, it should only be for other users in the same group. 

I just cant figure out how what should be altered in the current chatsample? I hope that i am not the only one that could be needing this functionality, and therefore it could be beneficial with a good example. 

This is a description of the process. 
1. A user visits http://www.domain.com/game/{id}
2. The user is instantly added to the group {id}
3. Only the users in the same group (id) are alerted that a new user joined. 
4. When a user leaves, only the users in the group are alerted that a user have left. 

Thanks in advance for your time.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "What about testing?" (#6423) at aspnet/Mvc
Events.RelatedBody:
It's not really an issue but still a big problem.
Lest me explain: one year ago, we began an important new project and it is mainly about micro services. It was obvious that ASP.NET Core v1 was not production ready and so we have selected .NET 4.6. We were expected Docker for Windows but did not know yet the details...
One year later it is obvious that if we want to do microservices with .NET and Docker, we have to use .NET Core.
The preview is out. Most of 3pp libraries are compatible. So it's time to migrate. But what about testing? testing controllers routing, etc. Do you have plan for it?
From my point of view, no one will use ASP.NET Core v2 (except for fun) if testing must be as painfulll as descibed in #6399? Waiting for 2.1 is not even serious and the 2.0 would be totally useless.
We just hope (and pray) that MyTested.AspNetCore.Mvc will be ready soon enough.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Remove unnecessary dependencies" (#1548) at aspnet/Identity

Closed issue "An error occurred while calling method 'BuildWebHost' on class 'Program'. Continuing without the application service provider. Error: Scheme already exists: Identity.Application" (#1540) at aspnet/Identity
Events.RelatedBody:
With Entity Framework Core 2.0.0 libraries, I was able to add multiple Identity instances and create a migration.

```
            services.AddIdentity<ApplicationUser, IdentityRole>()
                .AddEntityFrameworkStores<ApplicationDbContext>()
                .AddDefaultTokenProviders();
            services.AddIdentity<DistributorApplicationUser, IdentityRole>()
                .AddEntityFrameworkStores<DistributorApplicationDbContext>()
                .AddDefaultTokenProviders();
            services.AddIdentity<SupplierApplicationUser, IdentityRole>()
                .AddEntityFrameworkStores<SupplierApplicationDbContext>()
                .AddDefaultTokenProviders();
```

I added a library that used Entity Framework Core 2.0.1 and I upgraded all of my libraries to 2.0.1.  Now, the above codes produces

```
An error occurred while calling method 'BuildWebHost' on class 'Program'. Continuing without the application service provider. Error: Scheme already exists: Identity.Application
Unable to create an object of type 'ApplicationDbContext'. Add an implementation of 'IDesignTimeDbContextFactory<ApplicationDbContext>' to the project, or see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=851728 for additional patterns supported at design time
```

When I try to create a migration.

I am using the format:

```
public class Program
    {
        public static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            BuildWebHost(args).Run();
        }

        public static IWebHost BuildWebHost(string[] args) =>
            WebHost.CreateDefaultBuilder(args)
                .UseStartup<Startup>()
                .Build();
    }
```

If one package references 2.0.1 and the other packages reference 2.0.0, I get the following build error:

```
Severity	Code	Description	Project	File	Line	Suppression State
Error	CS1705	Assembly 'Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Relational' with identity 'Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Relational, Version=2.0.1.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=adb9793829ddae60' uses 'Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore, Version=2.0.1.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=adb9793829ddae60' which has a higher version than referenced assembly 'Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore' with identity 'Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore, Version=2.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=adb9793829ddae60'	SM.DAL	w:\documents\visual studio 2017\Projects\SelectMarketing\SM.DAL\CSC	1	Active
```

If all projects reference 2.0.0, I get the following migration error:

```
An error occurred while calling method 'BuildWebHost' on class 'Program'. Continuing without the application service provider. Error: Scheme already exists: Identity.Application
Unable to create an object of type 'ApplicationDbContext'. Add an implementation of 'IDesignTimeDbContextFactory<ApplicationDbContext>' to the project, or see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=851728 for additional patterns supported at design time.
```

At one point, I had three instances of Identity and was able to create three, separate migrations.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Change ApplicationProtocol to ReadOnlyMemory<byte> " (#2239) at aspnet/KestrelHttpServer
Events.RelatedBody:
#2182 
In the process I realized the prior change for merging the https and core packages had dropped the new netcoreapp2.1 TFM so all of the HTTP/2 code was disabled. Filed https://github.com/aspnet/KestrelHttpServer/issues/2238 for followup.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add functional tests for http2" (#2238) at aspnet/KestrelHttpServer
Events.RelatedBody:
There are not currently any functional test for the Http2 features. We accidentally disabled the entire feature when merging the https and core packages due to a missing TFM and didn't notice. https://github.com/aspnet/KestrelHttpServer/pull/2224

The big blocker here is the lack of consistent client support. However, even if there's one client on one of the OS's then that would be a good start.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Design] Add metadata to Razor" (#1894) at aspnet/Razor
Events.RelatedBody:
This PR introduces standard metadata to Razor. This change begins to
formalize the contract between generated code produced by Razor and
runtimes that want to load and interact with this code.

This is a step on making MVC a 'plugin' to Razor rather than the only
possible implementation. Since we're doing MSBuild work - this is the
right time to designate the current interaction between Razor and MVC as
'legacy' and move forward.

Additionally, we need the source thumbprinting to make re-compilation of
Razor a thing.

```
obj\Debug\netcoreapp2.1\MvcSandbox.PrecompiledViews.dll -> bin\Debug\netcoreapp2.1\MvcSandbox.PrecompiledViews
obj\Debug\netcoreapp2.0\MvcSandbox.PrecompiledViews.dll -> bin\Debug\netcoreapp2.0\MvcSandbox.PrecompiledViews
obj\Debug\net461\MvcSandbox.PrecompiledViews.dll -> bin\Debug\net461\MvcSandbox.PrecompiledViews
```

This should look like `MvcSandbox -> F:\git\aspnet\Mvc\samples\MvcSandbox\bin\Debug\$TFM\MvcSandbox.PrecompiledViews.dll`

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Identity: Consider less generic name for ManageController" (#86) at aspnet/Templates
Events.RelatedBody:
Manage is a very generic name and you would probably expect http://abcdefg/Manage to be about managing something from your applications business domain rather than user accounts.

ManageAccount would probably be a better name.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Need more templates" (#115) at aspnet/Templates
Events.RelatedBody:
MVC 6 project templates should include a test project template. And the main ASP.NET 5 Preview Templates / Web Application or ... / Empty templates should have a few more sub-options, enabling for example addition and removal of XML support, creation of a minimal MVC project, or adding in EF (without choosing Individual User Accounts authentication).

Hopefully this will allow the new project dialogue to enable the options shown below -- plus a few options specific to MVC 6.
![disabled project features](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6431421/8257821/2a76a606-1665-11e5-8e75-cdb21473f6a1.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Need a SPA template" (#137) at aspnet/Templates
Closed issue "Poor user and dev experience in Identity email confirmation" (#365) at aspnet/Templates
Events.RelatedBody:
There are two issues using the default template for identity when using email confirmation.

Following the guide here: http://docs.asp.net/en/latest/security/authentication/accconfirm.html

Poor user experience: When you click "Register" it sends the email off, but just redirects the user to the Home controller. Redirecting to something else to indicate they have to confirm their account would be a better example. Perhaps the default template should have such a view OOTB.

Poor dev experience: When logging in with an external account (lets say Facebook) if the account doesn't exist you get thrown into AccountController.ExternalLoginConfirmation, great. This screen requires an email, so you complete the registration then you're logged in but never shoots off the email confirmation link here. Perhaps a commented out section in this action to deal with this would improve the dev experience here.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "MVC Template Should Apply ResponseCache Attribute to Error Action" (#382) at aspnet/Templates
Closed issue "Add a flow for changing email in the Manage page" (#406) at aspnet/Templates
Events.RelatedBody: Porting from ASP.NET Identity repo https://github.com/aspnet/Identity/issues/727

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Don't create Project_Readme.html for ASP.NET 5 Empty" (#423) at aspnet/Templates
Events.RelatedBody: I created an empty project for both ASP.NET 4 and ASP.NET 5. The ASP.NET 5 project had a Project_Readme.html and the ASP.NET 4 one did not. I'm not aware if that was on purpose or not, but we should be consistent with the empty projects. I think we should not add the Project_Readme.html for all Empty projects.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support On-Premises option for Work & School Accounts" (#444) at aspnet/Templates
Events.RelatedBody: Support this for Web APIs and Web Apps.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "aspnetcore-ci-*, aspnetcore-volatile-* feeds being deprecated" (#282) at aspnet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
As part of some of our infrastructural changes, we're discontinuing the use of the following feeds and may remove them entirely in the future:
* https://dotnet.myget.org/f/aspnetcore-ci-dev 
* https://dotnet.myget.org/f/aspnetcore-ci-release
* https://dotnet.myget.org/f/aspnetcore-volatile-dev
* https://dotnet.myget.org/f/aspnetcore-volatile-release

If you're currently using one of these feeds in your projects to pick up our daily builds, we recommend migrating to https://dotnet.myget.org/f/aspnetcore-dev.

Please use this discussion topic - https://github.com/aspnet/Home/issues/2292 - for feedback and questions.
